Name: Mining Colony Duel
Description:
Mining Colony Duel is a 1-2 player "BYOP" (bring your own pencil) adaptation of Mining Colony, a print-and-play game that requires no components other than the printed sheets and pencils.

In the game, you build a mining colony on a distant planet. At the start of each round, players bid for resources, which include polyomino tiles, domes, landing pads, and science stations. After players reveal their bids, the players place (draw) the resources onto their sheets, trying to accomplish various things, such as having multiple items of the same type in a row or column.

After eight rounds, players score based on the development of their colonies.

Name: Raketofix
Description:
The children blow a little rocket from one planet to the other planet. On every planet, they have to solve different tasks which involve some gymnastics, puzzle games or quizzes.
The kid who solves the most tasks wins at the end.

—user summary

Name: Das Ringelspiel
Description:
Every player is a visitor on a fairground and tries to drive all the four different wagons of the merry-go-round. But the funny clown tries his best to distract the players and changes the places of the wagons!
The child who first manages to drive all wagons wins.

—user summary

Name: Spacy-Racing/Auto-Rennen
Description:
Two racing games in a single box

Car-racing:
Objective: Be the first ending the car race by passing target space the 3rd time (or more if agreed by the players)
- moving by turns -
roll the die, move your meeple & and follow instructions for some fields.
On each field only 2 cars are allowed to stay.

Space-racing:
Racing with the Alien "Spacy" through the space in a round course starting from the earth to moon and mars and back.
Objective: Be the first ending the space race by passing field 70. 
- moving by turns -
roll the die, move your meeple & and follow instructions for some fields.

—user summary

Name: Rauf & Runter
Description:
A tactical dice game where each player tries to run as fast as possible. At the same time, each one needs to stop at least seven times, but the more you stop, the more points you'll score. What a dilemma...

The winner is the player with the most stops.

—user summary

Name: Arche Noah
Description: This is a funny jump & run game for children. The child who is the first one in putting all his animals and Noah in the ark wins the game.

Name: Wer hat mein Häuschen?
Description:
The players try to catch the dogs to put them in their corresponding dog kennels. 
Each play gets the same amount of dog kennels. All dog cards are put in the middle of the table. The starting player roles the dice three times. If the dice shows at least 2 times the same colour, the player can put one dog in the kennel of this colour. 
The player who is the first one in putting the dogs of the correct colours in his dog kennels wins.

—user summary

Name: Fix und Foxi picknick Memo-Lotto
Description:
Fix and Foxi make a picnic.
Each player has a board which shows a picnic blanket.
Each picnic blanket has the same 9 elements (picnic theme) printed on it.

Objective:
Complete your picnic as first, but don't pick the mice. 
On players turn he selects one memory tile and turns it open.
If it's an element he still needs (not covered by an equal tile or a mouse tile) he takes and places it. Otherwise he turns it on the back side at the old position.
If the player finds a mouse he can choose if he place it on 1 free field on his blanket or if he puts it back.
The game ends, when 1 player has placed 1 tile on each of the 9 fields on his blanket.
Every player removes all mice and 1 good tile for each mouse tile from his blanket. For every remaining tile he gets 1 point. The player who ends the game gets 2 additional points. The player with the highest amount of points wins.

—user summary

Name: Boss in der Bank
Description:
The player are employees in a bank who want to become CEO. Therefore, each player needs to answer questions and if he knows the right answer, he moves up the corporate ladder. 
The fastest and most skilled player will become CEO and win the game.

—user summary

Name: Wortspiel
Description:
This is a collection of word games where children can easily learn the different senses of various word pairs.
It contains 48 tokens which form 24 pairs.

Puzzle game for 2-6 children
One half of the pairs is put face up on the table, whereas the other half is put face down. Then one of hidden tokens is put face up as well and the children have to find the corresponding partner. The fastest child gets the pair. In the end, the child with the most pairs wins.

Memory game for 2-6 children
All tokens are put face down on the table and the children try to find pairs according to the actual memory rules. The one with the most pairs wins.

Homonym game for 4-6 children
2 kids secretly take one word pair and both of them explain their word to the other children. The child who is the first one to guess the word wins.

—user summary

Name: Chapter 4: The Moonlight Escapade
Description:
Chapter IV sees you infiltrating a small desert camp to locate and decipher a secret message left for you.

You must figure out your next steps by examining the items left in the camp, deconstructing them and reforming them into new tools.

---

Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rekorde Quiz
Description:
A simple quiz card game with 107 cards. Each card covers a specific topic about world records in sports, culture etc. with 4 questions. The answers are on the backside of the cards. Players try to answer the questions and score points.

—user summary

Name: Erzähl mir was!: Wiener Spielschule
Description:
This game encourage children to remember and explain easy stories. It contains 50 tokens with images of some terms, such as apple, bike, street. These tokens are put face down on the 8 fields of the game board. 
In the first round, the starting player turns the tokens of one field face up and tells a fairy tale inclduing all the terms of the tokens on his field. He puts the tokens face down again and the next player starts to tell a story about the next field.   
In the second round, the children have to remember the terms. Therefore, a field is selected randomly and the player mentions all the terms of this field. For every correct one, he gets the token. 
The child with the most tokens wins.

—user summary

Name: Die Simpsons: Drunter und Drüber in Springfield
Description:
Each player is one of 8 "The Simpsons" characters.
There are 5 Springfield locations (Kwik-E-Market, School, Moe's bar, nuclear power plant, TV channel). On each location the player can gat a typical thing (e.g. beer at Moe's), a new order card or fullfill an order card he has on his hand.
The player who fullfills 3 order cards first, wins the game.
On players turn he can choose 1 of 4 moving possibilities (monorail, car, skate board, feet). There are differences in cost, speed and precision.
2 additional rules: moving by feet allows to move the barrier (drunken Barnie), which blocks the monorail and the street (for all except skate board).
On each order card there is a "being mean" possibility. This can be done for free if you fullfill the order. The victim can be choosen. It can also be executed by giving back one order card and an additional thing.

Name: Tier Legespiel
Description:
The cards with half funny pictures of animals are shuffled and dealt evenly to the players. The players now play cards in turn. If the next player can complete an animal, he may take the cards. If not, then he must place another card in front of him.
Whoever has collected the most complete animals at the end wins.

—user summary

Name: Chapter V: Serpents of the Sand
Description:
Chapter V invites you to investigate an archaeological excavation site in the desert. Starting with a battered journal and some cryptic notations, you find four dig sites across which 12 scales of a great beast are scattered.

You must follow the archaeologist's eleven-day research mission to locate the resting place of a fallen star.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chapter VI: Milton Manor
Description:
Chapter VI brings you to the stately Milton Manor. From a mysterious note slid under your hotel room door, you know to examine the portraits, blueprints, and books you find in the house.

You must locate and unlock the vault in the manor to complete the investigation and recover the shard before your adversaries get there first.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chapter VII: Access Denied
Description:
As you are chased in a speeding van, you must use everything you've learnt as a Guardian to access the Mysterious Companies files.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chapter VIII: Thornhill Forest
Description:
We believe that a former Guardian is living in isolation in the ancient forest of Thornhill. Before we lost contact with him, he left two things for us: a utility knife and a tin with a compass and some polaroids. We are entrusting you with these items, knowing that you have the tools to find him.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chapter IX: The End of the Line
Description:
You board a train with one of our allies. Make sure that you have the run of the vehicle; however, you may need to keep things on track with your quick thinking and decoding skills.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl: (Second Season Edition) – Glorious Gifts Promo Card
Description:
Promo card found in Issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

"Every year, gifts are exchanged at the end of the season. Will our players get what they wished for this year? Or will it be more patterned socks and spare underwear!"

TIMING

Play this card during the pre-game sequence, after step 5 but before step 6.

DURATION

This card expires at the end of this game.

EFFECT

When you play this card, select a player on your team, roll a D6 and apply the corresponding effect until this card expires:

On a 1, the selected player has opened a brand new pair of socks Woo. This card has no additional effect. 
On a 2-3, the selected player gains a Primary Skill of your choice.
On a 4-5, the selected player gains a Primary Skill, Secondary Skill or a Trait of your choice. 
On a 6, the selected player may improve their MA, ST, AG or PA by 1.

Name: Chapter X: What Lies Beneath
Description:
You enter the sewer system underneath the looming tower. Will you be able to navigate the winding tunnels with what you have on you?

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chapter XI: Floor Sixty-Four
Description:
You arrive at the tower of Starfall Corporation. You find a note with a simple message 'Floor Sixty-Four' - the Restricted Research Department. There must be some clues left behind that points to the last artifacts. It's time to start exploring Floor Sixty-Four!

Will you be able to locate the last artifacts?

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chapter XII: Project Nexus
Description:
This is the finale of Season One. We have been sworn to secrecy, we will reveal nothing.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – A Swig Of Wild Snake Tactics Card
Description:
Card was available in issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

Play this gang tactic when activating a friendly fighter.

Place the thin end of the Flame template in contact with the active friendly fighter. All fighters touched by the Flame template (both friend and foe) gain the Intoxicated condition and the Doused in Alcohol condition. Playing this card counts as the chosen fighter's activation.

Intoxicated fighters are marked with an Intoxicated token and suffer a -1 penalty to BS and WS checks for the remainder of the battle. For the remainder of the battle, fighters Doused In Alcohol are automatically set on fire the first time they are hit by a weapon with the Blaze trait.

Name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – Ordnance Delivery Promo Card
Description:
Card found in Issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

As two battlegroups clash, low-orbit aircraft brave the blizzard conditions to unleash blind bombing runs upon the two sides.

If all players agree, the card can be added to an existing Open Engine War deck or used on its own. At the start of each Strategy phase, the First Player rolls a D10. Until the end of the round, the long range characteristic of all weapons is reduced by a number of inches equal to the number rolled (to a minimum of the weapon's short range). In addition, each player, starting with the player who is not the First Player, may place a 5" Blast marker anywhere on the battlefield and Scatter it D10 inches. Any model at least partially under the template suffers D3 S7 Hits, as if hit by a weapon with the Ordnance trait.
Families: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)

Name: Kegel Knirpse
Description:
It's a bowling for kids.
Additional the kids should use the mages for building pyramids with them to train their mechanical abilities.

—user summary

Name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Side Stories 2
Description:
Science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering battle of Starzone Vanfleet and 6th siege of Iserlhon.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 6 to 14 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Setting: Legend of the Galactic Heroes

Name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Side Stories 3
Description:
Science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering battle of Dagon star zone and 2nd battle of Tiamat Star zone.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 6 to 14 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Setting: Legend of the Galactic Heroes

Name: Escape Adventures: Von Wikingern und Runenmagie
Description: Family friendly escape game in a viking age setting. The story driven game includes solving puzzles as well as some deductive skills and offers a scoring at the end based in the age of the group and the used hints.

Name: Pékin Express
Description:
Pékin Express the board game is a race in which the players will move across Europe or Asia and collect points. The game ends when a player reaches the finish line (Lisbon or Beijing) and the player with the most Amulet points wins.

Once the board chosen (Asia for 2 to 4 players ; Europe for 4 to 6 players) and the setup complete, the first round begins. A round is structured as follows:

     The players draft their 5 Travel cards.
     The player with the Red Flag card in hand must play it and take the Red Flag token. Then they take their turn by playing a Travel card or by passing. When a player reaches first a city with no Stage Token, they gain a face down Amulet card and place a Stage Token on that city.
     The players continue to take their turn in order in a similar fashion until every player has passed consecutively.


Such rounds keep going until the end of the game is triggered immediately as soon as a player reaches the finishing line (and by doing so, they gain 3 Amulet cards).

Each player counts their Amulet values, the player with the most points wins.

Name: Vrahode: The Calteeryn Ascension
Description:
Vrahode - The Calteeryn Acension is an adventure/dungeon crawl board game, the second in a series of five games, designed by Jeffrey Irving. Following the initial game Age of Prophecy (2024) this massive "core box" is a solo/co-op game for 1-6 players where players can choose to journey through huge multi-quest campaign that sprawls over the heights and depths of the mysterious world of Vrahode or choose one of five other modes of play as well as four difficulty levels!

The core box campaign victory condition: "Calteeryn" (the chosen one) must learn the ruhl (magic) of each crafted race in the game while facing mounting threats. This is done by journeying through the eight unique biomes of the Overlands, Underlands, and Oceans of the world of Vrahode.

Dice-based combat is enhanced by powerful skill deck building and racial abilities unique to each race. Every enemy encounter is different, with the enemy behavior deck threatening to change how the heroes must fight them each battle!

The world of Vrahode is based on a narrative first imagined in 1990 by designer Jeffrey Irving. The Vrahode series of games includes a introductory game Vrahode - Age of Prophecy and three additional expansions: The Enlightened & The Enslaved, Facing The Storm, and The False Gods' Deceit. All are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content, adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode! This game is compatible with our proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger, players can create dynamic, multi-level dungeons up to five levels deep.

—description from the publisher

Name: Holly Jolly: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Card Set
Description:
Available as part of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

This set of Present cards consists of three total cards, one each of the following items: Dice Tower, Dice, and Board Games.

These three cards can be shuffled into your presents/stockings deck. At the end of the game if a player manages to collect one card from this set, they score 1 point. If they can get two, they score 2 total points. But if they can manage to collect all three, then they will earn a big ol 18 points!

-description from publisher

Name: Just One: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A pack of 5 new words for Just One, chosen by Dice Tower fans! (ADDED TO DECK 6-8-24)

Name: Wavelength: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A pack of 8 new cards (and 1 title card) for Wavelength, created by the Dice Tower team!

Cards include:
Good Game/Bad Game
Cooperative Game/Competitive Game
Best Pie/Worst Pie
Tiny Game/Huge Game
Short Game/Long Game
Boring Movie/Exciting Movie
Good Hot Dog Condiment/Bad Hot Dog Condiment
Necessary Clothing/Unnecessary Clothing

Name: MonsDRAWsity: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

3 new cards with the Dice Tower theme to add to your game.

Name: The Artemis Project: Chill Communication Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

This is an Expedition for use in the game.

Name: Creature Comforts: Game Table Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

2 identical cards. Text says:
Each turn, you may re-roll one or both of your family dice up to twice, before placing any workers.

Name: Fickle: Decree Rules Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Decree Cards add an option rule to make each game of Fickle even more unique. During the set up of your next game, choose a Decree Card and follow the new rule(s). Each Decree adds a new twist that makes your game more challenging.

Each Decree Card uses the same icons to signal how the rule changes Set Up, Direct Action or Scoring for the entire game. Where the rule book conflicts with a Decree Card, follow the Decree Card instead.

Includes 3 double sided cards:
Rules Card / Family Feud
Alpha Player / Top 10
Hidden Ally / Race to the Bottom

Name: Chiseled: Critic Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:

+ 6 if your final trash pile contains fewer cards than your sculpture.

Name: Tournament Fishing: The Deckbuilding Game – Dice Tower Boat Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:
Search Phase: Draw the top card of your deck or discard pile.

Name: Jurassic Parts: Paleo-Journalist Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:
Play this card during a split to reduce a player's total by one chisel before determining rank order (player cannot be reduced to zero). Give this card to that player who may re-use it in any future split.

Name: Curmudgeon: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A 10 card promo pack. Includes:
1 new Curmudgeon Card
3 new Insult Cards
6 new Life Cards

Name: Cloud Control: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A five card pack of word cards that can be mixed in with the other words cards in the base game.

Includes: Deck Builder, Flip the Table, Convention, Game Night, and Dice Tower.

Name: Panzer Strider
Description:
Miniatures agnostic skirmish game of mech on mech combat.

This is a game of mech combat in a science fantasy setting of battle and ambition. Of pirates and those of royal blood.

Any faction can fight any other faction it is assumed that the pirates will fight pirates when their ambitions do not align. And the noble's family’s will fight in petty conflicts for similar reasons.

You can design your own mechs and carrier then send them off to war. You need something to represent your forces. Model kits or LEGO are what I recommend. You will also need two sets of polyhedral dice and some paper for your character sheets. Last but not least: you will need a flat surface to play on. I also would recommend some books to use as terrain.

The game is won when you destroy or demobilize the opposing player's carrier or they do the same to yours.

In the future, I hope to introduce solo play and a campaign but for now let’s get to the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Allies
Description:
Legend has it that long ago, Gah'dir the supreme mage forged a weapon known as the Scarlet Sword in order to form an alliance with Bashok the great orc king. By wielding the sword together, they created the most powerful alliance ever built among enemies and gained a power like no other. Since then, the sword has disappeared and reappeared many times over the years and it has determined the destiny of all nations time and time again.
Recently, the legendary Scarlet Sword was rediscovered, causing the most powerful leaders in all the land to seek out an ally and once again prepare for war.

In Allies, you will create and control a fantasy army by uniting two different factions of your choice. You can either use your cards to command your troops or deploy them onto the battlefield. The unique abilities of each faction can be combined to create many different synergies, so choose wisely.

Allies is a competitive two-player card game in which every move matters. It includes tactical and strategic components. Prepare your strategies well and don’t get distracted! Remember that your plans need to change constantly to anticipate your enemies’ movements as well as to disrupt them.

In the end, the army that gains control of the battlefield first claims victory!

—description from the designer

Name: Racing Hedgehogs
Description: Racing Hedgehogs is a strategic family game that requires prediction skills and a touch of cunning in order to win... Each player on their turn plays a card from their hand, which determines which hedgehog to move and how many steps to take. The race ends when the first hedgehog reaches the end of the track.

Name: COAL&GUNS! US ships 1885 - 1905
Description:
This volume contains “ship cards” for the rule set  "COAL&GUNS!". In order to play with them you need the basic rulebook.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Pokémon All Stars Get Everyone & Battle Game
Description:
Introducing a Pokémon board game base on the Nintendo Pokémon franchise that everyone can enjoy getting and battle. Player starts the game from the starting square and becomes a Pokémon Trainer (Boys&Girls). Roll the dice in order like "Sugoroku" and proceed while following the instructions to collect Pokémon, item cards and event cards.

Collect over 200 Pokémon and challenge the awaited rival(Cards)!!The player who challenges the awaited rival and defeats it first wins.

Name: Three Sisters: Weather Expansion
Description:
The Weather expansion uses the value of the highest undrafted die to create a weather-related condition that will apply to the next round of play. This means that while the first round of the game will play normally, every subsequent round will have a weather effect that will provide emergent tactical decisions and opportunities for you as you farm.

The weather expansion board sits above the game board and the cloud meeple is used to mark the weather condition that is in play for the round.

Includes: weather board plus cloud and tractor wooden tokens

Note: This was a KS Exclusive mini-expansion and was FREE to KS backers. It will not be included with retail copies of the game,  but may be available directly from Motor City Gameworks in the future.

-description from publisher
Families: Series: Loaded Roll and Write (Motor City Gameworks)

Name: Eco Neighborhood
Description:
In Eco Neighborhood the most important thing is building a clean environment, so moving through the streets you will have the opportunity to use different means of transport and find out their pros and cons, but be careful, you can get stuck in a traffic jam! On your way to the finish line, every time you step on the Eco Fact field you will find out new and interesting information about renewable energy sources, and why it’s important to wisely spend the electrical energy! Eco Neighborhood will show you where to move to find out the importance of protecting our environment and how you can contribute in protection of the Planet.

On the way to the finish line you will find out new things and challenges. Some of the fields will move you forward, but some will move you back. Also you will have the opportunity to invest you hard earned points in order to save energy through energy efficient light bulbs, energy efficient windows, solar panels and isolation for your home. The road to your goal is field with lots of interaction and fun.

Eco Neighborhood was created as a didactic material as part of the project “Education on energy”. The project was realized by Eco Logic, and was supported by the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC).

Name: Smile & Play
Description: The board game is intended for pupils from 5th to 9th grade, and it comprises of a platform with 11 examples of everyday locations toward which the children/teams have to go. On the way to the location, they resolve exercises and tasks for improving of the English language skills, through cards with activities, questions, fun facts – given by the mentor/teacher/parent that has the role of Game Guide/Maser.

Name: Likes
Description:
Likes is a party game in which we will discover the tastes of others.

Do you think you know the people around you? Are you one of those people who see other people at first? Put it to the test!

In the Likes card game you will be able to see first-hand that people are never known as well as we like to believe. Try to guess the tastes and hobbies of other people through the images on the cards. At first everything will depend on your intuition, but little by little all people will become an open book for you. Of course the feeling will be reciprocal.

Likes is fun while we get to know each other!

Name: Bearithmatic
Description:
This set of beautifully illustrated cards with thirteen different animals set across the four seasons offers a range of educational matching and addition-based card games. Get all ages engaged, with breath taking scenery and cute critters from around the world.

Kick off with Bearithmatic to build the largest wildlife reserve, or enjoy one of the other four classic games included in the accompanying rulebook.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Skinchangers
Description:
Skinchangers have the rare ability to project their consciousness into nearby creatures, altering their behavior. This can be used simply, perhaps having them perform tricks. But it can also be used in combat. It’s bad enough when an enemy unit is advancing on your position. It’s worse when that unit is flanked by giant wolves or bears.

The Skinchangers unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Free Folk commanders a new option for their armies. The Skinchanger Unit Attachment can be placed in any unit, ignoring usual Unit Attachment rules (so they can join a unit with another attachment already in it). When being added, the player can also add their animal unit to the table. When the Skinchanger’s unit activates, the accompanying animal can activate immediately afterward, creating perfect “one-two punch” combinations. Just be sure that the two are never further than Long Range from one-another, or the Skinchanger is killed. Either situation will cause the animal to also be destroyed.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Flick of Faith: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack B from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A set of 5 additional laws to add to the base game.

Includes:

    Top 1
    What's NOT Appearing
    Dice Tower Con
    Unboxing
    Space Encounter

Name: Lizard Wizard: Forest Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack B from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign. Was also available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

After each trip to the Dungeon is complete add one "forest" creature card to the Dungeon deck and shuffle. This means that the dungeon gets a little bit harder each time a player goes there.

Includes 8 cards and 1 rules cards.
Gelatinous Cube
Beastman
Witch
Faerie
Gnoll
Centuar
Minotaur
Satyr

Name: Herding Cats
Description:
Felines are causing havoc! Race against your opponents to round up four-of-a-kind. But don’t let the cat out the bag! Bring fun, excitement and lightning reflexes to your next gathering with Herding Cats, the fast-paced card grabbing game.

If you've ever played the classic game of "Signal", this is it but with a cat twist! This game is played in teams of pairs, involves a secret signal, and cat-astrophic mayhem to collect and complete their chosen cat set first! All in real-time!

Name: Porno Charades
Description:
Act out funny porno titles like ‘Womb Raider’ or ‘Prodzilla’ for your team mates to guess.

No talking allowed, only gestures – the ruder the better!

Name: The Mole
Description:
The Mole is a hilarious, naughty, conversation-based game in which players use observation, bluff and cunning to win. The spies only have a few minutes to identify the mole in one of 16 secret, adult-only locations – from a porn film set to an organ-harvesting hospital – while the mole is only ever one incriminating answer away from blowing their cover. Can the mole guess the secret location and foil the plot? Or will the spies unmask the mole in time?

—description from the publisher

Name: Momiji: Falling Leaves
Description:
With the Falling Leaves tokens you can earn you extra victory points for having Leaf card majorities.

The player with the highest visible number (1 or higher) on one of their leaf card piled takes the corresponding Falling Leaf token from the center of the table or from another player. If taken from the center, they may also refresh one of their personal Landscape Abilities.

Each Falling Leaf token is worth 5 points at the end of the game.

Name: Momiji: Metal Leaf
Description:
The Metal Leaf lets you pay one less Acorn when performing the “take leaf cards” action and revealing 4 new cards from the deck, or when activating an Objective token.

During Set-up, give the Metal Leaf to the last player. The owner gets the Acorn discount when they pass the Metal Leaf to the player on their right.

Name: Star Realms: Merc Captain Garcia Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack B from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Cost: 3
Damage: 5
Text: Choose a faction. You count as having an additional card of that faction in play this turn.

Name: Shootout in Dingstown
Description:
In this tabletop adventure you take over a gang of up to 8 cowboys or other western characters and compete against your fellow players in Dingstown. You can equip your heroes with their own character traits that make them unique in the game.
The game with German-language rules is not only suitable for skirmishes in the Wild West, but also on all other locations.

Name: Chakra: Yin Yang Goodies
Description:
4 promo Cards to add to the game.

Module C: Special abilities
- This turn, when you receive energies, take any energy from the bag instead of from the Lotus board. Then place it as usual: in the Bagghya Bubble or directly on a Chakra with an Inspiration token
- This turn, when you channel energies, you can reuse
an action already occupied by an Inspiration token by
superimposing a second inspiration token.

Module D : Objectives
- Be the first or second to harmonise
the 3 Chakras on the card (violet,
light blue and green).

Module D : Objectives & Module A : Yin-Yang
- Be the first or second to complete 2 Yin-Yang tokens

Name: FIVES
Description:
If You Can Count
You Can Play

Fast!! Fascinating!! Fun!!
A game for ages 5 to 105
2 to 6 persons may play

HOW TO PLAY: Shuffle deck. Deal four cards face up to each player. Turn one card face up in the center of the playing area and place the remaining pile face down next to it. The player to the left of the dealer begins by putting a card with the next numerical value on top of the card that was turned up. Only one card can be played. If the player does not have the right card, he picks a card from the face down pile. If he picks the right card, he must play it. If he picks the wrong card, he places it face up with his other cards. The player to his left then takes a turn. If the pile you pick from gets used up, play continues. Each player, in turn, must play the right card if he has it, or, pass if he does not have it. The first one to play all of his cards is the Game Winner. The deal is passed clockwise for succeeding games.

Name: Variations on a Theme: Supplementary Rules for Monopoly
Description:
A collection of Monopoly variants, intended (except for the last) to be used separately:


     The Investment Fund allows players to invest their money. The principal can never be taken out but every time a player passes GO they receive 10% interest. This can radically change the nature of the game, among other things speeding it up significantly.



     The Auction Game requires all properties to be auctioned when landed on for the first time. This tends to slow the game down and reduces reliance on luck somewhat.



     Building Past Hotels allows further property development. This makes the cheaper monopolies more interesting. A set of extended property cards is provided which show the additional costs and rents.



     Ruffles and Flourishes, a set of small tweaks which can be used together or separately. One is a new set of "wahoo" cards which can all be kept until a player wants to use them; a set is provided.

Name: Momiji: Morning Dew
Description: Morning Dew allows you to play Momiji with up to 5 players. Morning Dew cards can also be added to a 1-4 player game in place of another leaf type. The blue Morning Dew leaf cards can be collected in their own pile in a player’s personal area as usual, or they can be played as Wild cards/Jokers. When played as Wild you can add it to the top of any color of leaf card following the usual rules. You can also play any color of leaf on top of a blue leaf. You cannot have two or more leaf cards of the same color visible on top of your piled at the end of your “play leaf cards” action, and you can never play a blue leaf onto a closed pole showing the Torii symbol. If used as a Wild, immediately take the blue leaf token (-3 victory points at the end of the game).

Name: Modern Royalty
Description:
Modern Royalty is a trick-taking game for exactly six players using a standard 52-card deck plus two jokers.

In each hand the deck is dealt out and the players then bid; bids can be 1-36 in a suit or 1-25 in "anarchy."

If the winning bid is in a suit, that suit is trump and cards are ranked normally, except that aces are special and jokers are the lowest members of the trump suit. Play is fairly standard (must follow suit, not required to trump) except that the aces in the non-trump suits are assassins which kill trump cards, and the trump ace is a guard which stops one assassin.

If the winning bid is in anarchy, there is no trump suit and cards are ranked ace high to ten low, with the face cards being equal below the ten; the jokers form their own "pariah" suit. If a pariah is led to a trick no one wins it.

Scoring depends on whether the play was in a suit or in anarchy, and if in a suit each player's score depends in part on what is taken by three of the other five players. The player who won the bid must always achieve their bid in points or be penalized; if the bid was in a suit then other players who last bid that suit must also do this.

Play is to 626 points.

There is an optional rule for an extra "knife" bid which basically means that the knifing player(s) work deliberately against the winning bidder.

Name: Solitaire 34
Description:
Solitaire 34 is played with a standard 52-card deck. It assigns court cards a value of 10 points and all other cards their face values. This gives the deck a total of 340 points; the goal of the game is to divide the deck into 10 stacks of 34 points each.

At the start of the game the player deals a row of three cards and a row of four cards. They then find any subset of those seven cards that total exactly 34, set them aside, and deal cards to fill the empty slots.

If there is no way to make 34, the player chooses one of the two rows of cards to set aside and deals a new row. They can bring the set-aside row back in later by completely emptying the row of matching size. Several rows can be set aside at any given time.

Name: Eagles
Description:
Eagles is a Diplomacy variant which is set in an alternate history Roman Empire; the game starts in Spring 118 CE shortly after the assassination of Hadrian. The game can accommodate 2-12 players but is recommended for 4-6.

Each player starts in one of a group of given supply centers and has two more from a different group as allies; which ones each player gets is determined randomly.

The basic rules are modified in three ways:


     Reinforcements are handled differently.



     Many spaces on the board are held by barbarians. A force entering one of these must roll a die and may be destroyed or repelled.



     Naval movement and combat is very different, with multiple fleets being able to coexist in the same space, die-rolling, etc.

Name: Home Run Derby
Description:
Home Run Derby is a simple baseball game. Each player creates a nine-member team either by rolling on a table or by choosing a real team's current starting lineup; in each case only the batting averages matter.

When a baseball player comes up to bat two dice are rolled to determine if they get a hit, sacrifice, walk, or are out. If they get a hit a roll is made on a second table to determine the outcome. Bases can be stolen, which is also resolved via dice roll.

The defending player's only decision is whether to issue an intentional walk.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark Attachments I
Description:
House Stark is known for extolling integrity, justice, and loyalty. Those that flock to the Direwolf’s Banner feel that what they are fighting for is right. This feeling is instilled in the officers that are in charge of the units within the Stark army. House Stark might not have the deepest coffers, but what they lack in raw materials they make up for in determination.

The Stark Unit Attachments box set gives House Stark players in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game 11 new Unit Attachments that they can use to customize their forces. They can enhance their troops with the likes of Sworn Sword Captain, Umber Champion, Crannogman Warden, and more. Each one will allow Stark players to build an army that fits exactly the type of battle they want to fight.

Contents:
11 Miniatures
  â€£ 2 Sworn Sword Captains
  â€£ 2 Umber Champions
  â€£ 2 Crannogman Wardens
  â€£ 2 Mormont Veterans
  â€£ 2 Crannogman Survivalists
  â€£ 1 Winterfell Guardian
11 Attachment Cards
Families: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Beast in Show
Description:
Fantasy monster pet deck builder.  Create the ultimate team of monsters, beasts, and cryptic to compete in pet competitions. Collect pets, companions, and abilities of different elements and combine their powers to win the most trophies.

Each player starts with a deck of ten starter cards, and a starting pet. Your pet stays out on your player mat, ready to compete using its Beauty, Brains, and Brawn stats! Each turn, draw 5 cards from your deck. Some cards will add points to your pets' Beauty, Brains, or Brawn statistics.  Others have money that let you buy more powerful cards or pets from the marketplace.  Cards can also contain abilities that let you improve your hand, improve your pets, or sabotage your competitors! All cards also align to one of four elements. By pairing cards of the same element, you can activate even better abilities and add extra pets to your game board to help win competitions. After buying cards, placing pets on your mat, activating abilities, or any combination of those things, place your hand in the discard pile, and draw a new hand.  As the game progresses, your deck will grow more and more powerful!

Once the pets on your player mat, with the assistance of any cards in your hand that turn, have enough Beauty, Brains, and Brawn, go claim your prize! Each trophy has a unique combination of statistics required to claim, and once you've claimed a prize no one else can claim the same one. Trophies also give you victory points to win the game.  But be careful.  Once your pets win a trophy, they retire and you will need to purchase new ones for the next competition.

Play until all the competitions are claimed, then add up victory points from your trophies. Be strategic: some cards, including pets, also contain victory points that count towards victory. So don't assume the person with the most trophies is always the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Dothraki Screamers
Description:
The warrior ways of the Dothraki might make them appear as simple barbarian savages, screaming into the sky as they charge into battle. And many commanders have underestimated them because of those stereotypes. A Dothraki will spend more time on their horse than they will off of it, and with that experience comes skill that regular training will never achieve. Despite being unarmored, it is still difficult for a trained swordsman to land a significant hit on a mounted Dothraki.

The Dothraki Screamers unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Targaryen commanders a solid cavalry unit for their forces. These fearsome fighters can charge quickly into battle, dealing out deadly blows. Skilled commanders will use them as a lightning-fast strike force, avoiding getting them into protracted combats, lest their fewer numbers start to catch up with them.
Families: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Covert Cues: The Deduction Game
Description:
Covert Cues is an ingenious social deduction game for 3-12 players about slick double meanings and spy talk, revolving around the premise of 2 hidden individuals attempting to discover who each other are by referencing their secret code word without being caught by the public.

"The Hacker and the insider Admin have planned to finally meet face to face at the monthly office meeting, in order to finalise their plans to blackmail the company.

Amongst a group of regular users, the Hacker and the Admin will attempt to identify each other by using their hidden code word.

However, the company has been made aware of the potential of an inside job and users will be alert and observant for any suspicious behaviour.  If their plans are exposed, there will be drastic consequences."

Here is the Link to Order!
https://www.ebay.com.au/itm/126597913765

Play the online version of the game here: https://tabletopia.com/games/covert-cues-the-deduction-game

Name: Тактическое Лото (Tactical Lotto)
Description:
Ð¢Ð°ÐºÑ‚Ð¸Ñ‡ÐµÑÐºÐ¾Ðµ Ð›Ð¾Ñ‚Ð¾ ("Tactical Lotto"), published in Moscow (Soviet Union) 1929.

Though the game is titled as Lotto game, it is typical roll and move game about war and military tactics with separate game board with 96 stops (16 cards of 6 stops each) and additional cards with questions about each stop. The first player, who cross whole route first, wins a game.

—user summary

Name: The Clever Knight
Description:
A strategy game for 2 players.
Try to create a sequence of 4 tiles of your color inside the inner quadrangle of the board. Tiles advance in the
familiar chess steps and may be placed on top of each other. The game has simple rules and guarantees hours of fun.
A game for developing a thinking strategy and the ability to plan moves.

—description from the publisher

Name: No Na Me
Description:
No Na Me is an abstract strategy game for 2 players.
Play as a ring caster, in the attempt to reach the center of the board first. On your turn choose one of four available actions:

     move your player piece one space orthogonally.
     take control of a minion with the top most ring on your player piece.
     move a minion one space orthogonally.
     pick a ring that is orthogonally adjacent to you.


Use your limited resources to manipulate the game and outwit your opponent in this slow pace ballet of deception and strategy.

—description from the designer

Name: Durch Kampf zum Sieg
Description:
Whole title: "Durch Kampf zum Sieg, Original-Hakenkreuz-Gesellschaftsspiel“ (eng. "Through struggle to victory, Original swastika parlor game") made by Verlag August Haug, Berlin.

Game rules similar to game "Mensch ärgere dich nicht!", which is German version of Pachisi. Each player has a set of pawns that start in his or her corner of the board (this game is unique because the game boards layout is similar to swastika). The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by dice. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".

Name: Dream Home: Promo Tokens – #Shelfie
Description:
These are 'Shelfie' promo tokens for the game Dream Home. The first player to complete a three-card Living Room receives the 'board games bookshelf' promo token, which is worth 2 points. The second player with three card Living Room receives the 'board games shelf' promo token, which is worth 1 point.

The promo token is treated as every other furnishing token.

Name: Titan: It came from below!
Description:
It Came From Below is an expansion for Titan that introduces a resident extra-terrestrial! Miners will have to deal with the Alien as it moves around the crater, performing a variety of helpful or disruptive acts.
Each turn, players will have the option of controlling the Alien and using its powers. However, exactly what it does is determined randomly at the start of each game, and how you choose to use it is up to you...

It Came From Below! brings new extraterrestrial elements to Titan which open up a wealth of strategic possibilities! Each turn, the active player will have the option of activating and controlling the Alien by performing a certain trigger action. They will then be able to move and act with it, using it as they see fit. As well as having its own specific power to use, the Alien can spawn Sprogs onto Rigs it is present on, which will interact with them in a variety of ways.

The expansion also introduces a new Rig type; Alien Pools; which produce their own mysterious resource called Alien Crystals.

The Alien itself and all of its related elements each have unique effects which are determined by the Alien Tableau. This Tableau is made up of the Alien tiles, which are drawn randomly at the start of the game.

The Brain Tile determines when the Alien is “Activated”, meaning the triggering action that a player must perform in order to be able to use it.
 The Tentacle Tile determines the Alien’s special ability, which it can perform as an Action.

The Sprog Tile determines the effect of Alien Sprogs when they are spawned onto a Rig.

The Crystal Tile determines the properties of Alien Crystal Resources.

There are 5 tiles of each type, and the random generation of the Alien Tableau means that you’ll rarely come up against the same Alien twice! The effects can be good or bad, so you’ll have the choice of using the Alien to your own benefit, or turning it against your opponents...

Name: Titan: Starbot
Description:
Starbot is a Solo/AI mode for TITAN. Whether you’re searching for a challenging solo experience or just want to add another player to your game, Starbot’s rules and behaviour remain the same.

This top of the line automaton specialises in mining operations and has just touched down in Titan’s mining crater alongside you. It has been programmed to extract as much Deuterium as possible and to avoid polluting its ship’s Hold with Tholins. It will not be involved in extracting standard resources or in
meeting corporate Objectives. All Starbot cares about is Credits, and it will do anything it can to obtain as many as possible! It controls ultra-mobile Drones, expands its network efficiently and takes control of Rigs in the blink of an eye.
Starbot is a new kind of opponent and your results won’t only affect the STARDRILL™ bottom line, but also the future of all human TITAN workers in future mining operations.

Starbot includes 6 different AIs, represented by their own individual Command Boards. Each version provides a challenging experience in their own way!

—description from the publisher

Name: Titan: For Science!
Description:
For Science! introduces a 6th type of Rig to your games of Titan: Science Rigs! These new installations function mostly like normal Rigs - they can be added to your Network and activated as per the normal rules. However each time they’re activated, instead of generating a resource, they allow you to use the special powers shown on the Research Board. New technologies become available each time a Science Rig or Science Module is placed on the board. The more of these you unlock, the more powerful and versatile the Rigs become, but beware - each new power you unlock becomes available to other players too!

—description from the publisher

Name: Titan: The E-Team
Description:
Expand your operations with this 5th player expansion which takes Titan’s levels of player interaction even further. The race intensifies with the arrival of an additional competitor as you compete to be the first to complete Objectives, fulfil Planetary Orders, exploit Rigs and reach Titan’s treasure filled core…

Includes everything you need to play with a 5th player!

—description from the publisher

Name: A... B... C... D... SPEEDY
Description:
Play the classic, very popular and addictive game, but with a literal twist!
Get rid of the cards by putting down cards with identical first or last letters.
Do you think it’s easy?! 
Try doing it while competing rapidly… 
ABCD SPEEDY is an entertaining, fast-paced game to learn the English language by practicing reading, quick letter identification, and increasing your vocabulary at the same time.

—description from the designer

Name: Goblin Firework Fight
Description:
Goblins have come to the town of Sandpoint, intent upon stealing their fireworks for an upcoming festival. Do you have the goblin grit to pillage your way to victory and emerge from the town with the most fireworks?

The game is played over a number of rounds. Each round, every goblin takes a turn pulling a loot token from the town's treasure pile. These tokens might represent useful tools or valuable treasure like fireworks, dogslicers (goblin knives), or shields. Unfortunately, the tribe's most fearsome beast, a pig called Squealy Nord, is also hiding in the treasure, bringing mayhem and chaos to any who draw his token from the pile. You never know what you might get.

Fighty goblins can choose dogslicers and just steal from their neighbors instead of raiding the village. Smart goblins will take some shields to defend themselves from their peers. Crafty goblins with leadership qualities may choose instead to take the badge of leadership, the Pickle Token, signifying for all their prominence and importance as well as the right to pick first next time.

After 10 rounds and one last free for all opportunity to steal from each other on the way back home, one goblin is declared the "bestest goblin of the raid" and basks in glory and the admiration of their peers. Until the next raid...

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Guardians of the Galaxy Set
Description:
The Guardians of the Galaxy Set is an expansion for Marvel Zombies that adds a roster of space-dwelling characters to the game, including the ragtag members of the Guardians of the Galaxy. This band of living and zombie heroes must all contend with the momentous threat of zombie Thanos, as he wields the Infinity Stones to fulfill his mad plan!

Thanos acts as a special Enemy spawn that can be added to any mission, whether it be in Zombie Mode or Hero Mode. Every time Thanos activates, he will tap into the power of one of the stones (represented by a special Action deck). This will grant him additional game-altering effects during that Activation.

–description from the publisher

Name: Love, Career & Magic
Description:
Introducing "Love, Career & Magic"! âœ¨ A collaborative storytelling game set in a fictional reality TV show.


     Mythological creatures + modern-day jobs = reality TV fun!
     Race against the clock for high ratings each season.
     Blend of D&D and party games for easy, exciting gameplay.
     Perfect for newcomers to RPGs.
     As family-friendly as you want it to be.
     Laughter, zany scenarios, and unforgettable moments await.


Enter a whimsically quirky world where orcs code, gnomes tell jokes, and dragons wield spatulas as culinary masters. Play these extraordinary characters in a delightfully offbeat reality TV show and race against the clock to achieve the season's highest ratings!

A game is played in just twelve minutes over four rounds. "Love, Career & Magic" seamlessly blends the charm of Dungeons & Dragons (D&D) with the zany chaotic energy of party games. No character building or prep required—just dive in and let the enchanting adventure unfold!

Perfect for newcomers, this cooperative game offers family-friendly fun with endless customizable quirkiness. Experience laughter, outlandish TV scenes, and unforgettable moments in this whirlwind of a game.


				
				
					Examples scenes that can happen in a game				
				
					Scenario 1: "The Aisle Next to the Bathroom on the Plane"The Orc Web Designer, Elf Aspiring Firefighter, and Dark Elf Instagram Model stumble upon a misplaced hypnotist's watch, leading to chaotic and zany moments as they unintentionally hypnotize themselves and other passengers on the plane.

				
				
					Scenario 2: "6AM in a Government Building"The Gnome Comedian, Basilisk Lab Technician, and Leprechaun Bank Teller discover a hidden room filled with magical artifacts in the government building, triggering unpredictable chaos as they accidentally activate a time vortex, causing time to loop and their actions to have wacky consequences.

				
				
					Scenario 3: "A Comedy Show, But the Comedian is Racist"The Cockatrice Optometrist, Dragon Chef, and Ogre Bouncer combine their magical abilities to turn the racist comedian into a literal clown, creating uproarious chaos on stage and exposing his true colors to the audience.


				
				
					Learn more at lovecareermagic.com

Name: Space Time
Description:
In Space Time, you role play as a scavenger among the stars, flying your trusty rocket all around the universe, in an attempt to earn income, by completing tasks, finding items, and using tools at your disposal to gain an advantage.

However, watch out for "Space Pirates." They can take everything in your cargo hold, and set you back, big time."

Over the course of three rounds; players draft from a grid of 15 cards choosing to take a low, medium, or high risk card.  Flipping the card over will reveal if you have gained an item with income (victory points), a tool which will give you a optional action, an event which will give you an instant effect, or an attack card which will cause you to loose items.

Name: Supremacy 2021
Description: A revision of the Supremacy 2020 game, with streamlined rules and improved game board and pieces.  The game takes the improvements made in Supremacy 2020 and takes the game a step further, with less cyclical turns, country resources kept on a track on the main map, adding optional rules for alliances, terrain and weather, and more.

Name: 百合乱慕 (Yuri Ranbou)
Description: Play as girls attempting to gain a harem. Draft cards of various levels of strength with unique effects to form your hand and battle other players, winning the affection of various girls to build your harem. Over three rounds, each player plays a card from their hand. After resolving all effects, the player with the highest strength gains the girl targeted that round. At the end of the third round, the player with the most girlfriends wins the game.

Name: Tech Exchange
Description:
Tech Exchange is a multi-player, real-time trading card game for 2-6 Players. It uses a modern deck of cards called the Tech Deck. Each card in the Tech Deck represents stocks in companies that players trade. As players trade cards and use card abilities, the stock market gains value. Each stock card has card abilities that players can use during two turn-based effects rounds. Players score victory points based on the value of their final hand after all trading is completed. Players are trying to collect sets of triples, quadruples and a flush (cards that share a domain/suit).

REAL TIME TRADING – The players trade cards from their hands between each other in real-time. There are no turns and trading happens simultaneously between players following a few trading rules.

USE CARD EFFECTS – When a stock stack hits a value of three or no one wishes to trade anymore, trading pauses. Then, players take turns using effects on the cards in their hand. Trading continues. After all trading has completed, there is a second use effects round.

STOCK SCORING – After the second use card effects round, players tally up victory points based on the value of card groupings in their hand and the value of the stock market.

WINNER – After three rounds of play, the player with the most points is the winner. If tied, players share the victory.

TECH DECK AS A GAME SYSTEM - The Tech Deck is a modernized deck of cards bringing playing cards into the 21st century. It is a game platform designed to support many different games. Each card in the Tech Deck has unique game effects to create unique game experiences. Also, see Tech Grid Poker, Tech City which are other games that use the Tech Deck.

—description from the designer

Name: Fairy Tale Inn: Pixie Promo
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack B from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Add her card to the selection of character cards to play during setup.

Includes: 1 Character Card, 1 rules card, and 1 unpunched token sheet

Name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Brub Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack C from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A new mercenary card.

Special ability: Chain Shot
After each time this unit attacks, if all dice rolled have a bow icon it may attack again.

Name: Foundations of Rome: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack D from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

containing 1 new Invocation card, 1 new Role card, 1 new Objective card.

Objective card
Proprietor - Most size 1 and 2 buildings

Role card
Entitled - At the start of the game, you may select a monument and put it in your play area. Until the end of the game, only you may build this monument. If you build it, gain 2 VP.

Invocation card
Spared from Disaster - You may discard this card at any time on your turn: All other players must immediately choose and remove one of their own size 1 buildings from the board and return it to the supply. Those players replace their removed buildings with a Lot marker. Players who do not own a size 1 building or have no unused Lot markers may ignore this effect.

Name: Reavers of Midgard: Hnefatafl Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack C from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 3 identical cards.

When you collect this card, roll 2 combat dice and immediately score Glory equal to the number of hits you rolled.

Optionally, you may choose to take a Terror token and roll 3 combat dice to score additional Glory.

Name: Tainted Grail: Item Sets Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack D from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Basic rule:
Whenever you meet the requirements of a set (ie: you have the required cards or attributes), you may take its card and place it next to your items.

At any moment, if you stop meeting the requirements of a set (ie: because you had to discard an item), you must discard its card and the rules of the set stop affecting your character immediately.

Includes 5 cards:
Druid Set
Wyrdprowler Set
Knight Errait Set
Clan Warrior Set
Trapper Set

Name: Etherfields: Awakened Items & Actions
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack D from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A couple of new Actions and Items inspired by other games from the publisher.

Rules: To add these cards to the game, shuffle them into corresponding markets while setting up the game. They can be bought during the game using the normal rules.

Includes 5 cards:
Growing Crystals, Hibernation, Flick of Determination, A Great Wall, Menhir

Name: On the Underground: Engineering Crew
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Setup: Place on engineering crew tile per player next to the board and return the extras to the box.

Gameplay: A player may spend one of their actions to take an engineering crew tile. Each player may hold at most 1 of these tiles. It may be spend to take a branch tile or place a track token. Doing so does not cost an action.
